Recall'd from the brink of despair,</br>As light as a feather my mind;</br>Dissolved in the winds all my care,</br>Now PHILLIS has vow'd to be kind.
As blithesome, and chearful as May,</br>Together we range o'er the green;</br>Her beauties I pipe all the day,</br>All night I embrace her, my Queen.
Such innocent fondness, ye swains,</br>The great ones are strangers unto;</br>And Kings, (for we live on the plains)</br>But rarely such happiness know.
If daisies I pluck for her hair,</br>Or bil-berries bring from the rocks;</br>She smiles! — a reward! — the sweet fair,</br>And welcomes me back to the flocks.
A WREATH, now my Charmer has wove,</br>Of myrtle, and woodbine, and bays;</br>[Fond token of conjugal love]</br>And, "take it my Shepherd" she says.
As Muse, she engages my song,</br>My hours now are happily spent;</br>The Shepherds I'm envied among,</br>But care not, am wed to CONTENT.</br>
